pullRequest.body:
This PR contains the following changes:

 * The headline result: `LieAlgebra.IsKilling.isSemisimple_ad_of_mem_isCartanSubalgebra`
 * Necessary supporting lemmas in linear algebra / order theory

---

- [x] depends on: #12735

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9093493811/job/24992524418)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9093493811/job/24992523931)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9093493811/job/24992524165)
I don't understand this name. (But I also don't understand the name `MapSubtype` above.)
The idea of the name is that we are mapping submodules of a submodule `p` into the interval `Iic`, of submodules bounded above by `p`.

```suggestion
lemma IsNilpotent.restrict {R M : Type*} [Semiring R] [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M]
```
for max dot notation (-;
Shouldn't `hf` be explicit?

I agree `hf` should be explicit and I have renamed to `IsNilpotent.restrict`.

However I note that we still cannot use dot notation because this is in `Module.End` and not the root namespace, and I am not convinced it should be in the root.
Should we just rename `generalizedEigenspace` to `genEigenspace` globally? That name is wicked long.

I agree. I can do this if you wish (either before or after this PR). I note however that it might be more work than a simple search-and-replace if we wish to put `@[deprecated] alias ` notes in place.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion suffices âŸ¨x, hxâŸ© âˆˆ LinearMap.ker (traceForm K H L) by simpa using this ```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Cartan subalgebras contain only semisimple elements if the Killing form is non-singular and the coefficients are a perfect field.

source.title: The roots of a Lie algebra are a root system.
